alert.note: Alert for Jones; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 5:52PM CDT until June 17 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JONES AND NORTHERN TAYLOR COUNTIES... At 551 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Dyess Afb, moving east at 30 mph. Golf ball size is now capable with this storm! HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Caps around 555 PM CDT. Wylie around 605 PM CDT. Potosi around 615 PM CDT. Abilene and Hamby around 620 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Impact, Kirby Lake and Stith. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 261 and 292. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
